discriminate.translation[0].definitions[: to treat a person or group differently from another in an unfair way
It was found that the company still discriminated on the basis of race in promotions.
discriminate on the grounds/basis of something
Under federal law, it is illegal to discriminate against minorities and women.
to recognize a difference between things
Newborn babies can discriminate between a man’s and a woman’s voice.
the process of learning to discriminate fact from opinion
discriminate.translation[1].definitions[: to behave unfairly towards one group of people or one type of company or product
The court ruled that the state’s highway-use tax discriminated in favor of trucking companies based in Arkansas and against companies based in other states.
employment practices that discriminate against women
